Citation.Paragraph:
The genus
Strumigenys Strumigenys is known for having narrow and linear to sublinear mandibles, developed petiolar spongiform tissue, and specialized feeding habits (Baroni Urbani & De Andrade, 1994
Citation.Name: Baroni Urbani & De Andrade

Citation.Paragraph: The dacetine ants of the World were revised by Bolton (2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph:
Two undetermined species which closely resemble
Strumigenys lewisi Strumigenys lewisi Cameron , 1886
Citation.Name: Cameron

Citation.Paragraph:
have been recognized in Japan. Both of the two species which are tentatively named S. sp. 4 and S. sp. 9 have been indistinguishable from
Strumigenys lewisi S. lewisi in workers. S. sp. 4 was first recorded by Sonobe (1977
Citation.Name: Sonobe

Citation.Paragraph:
as
Strumigenys Strumigenys sp. 1 [Japanese name: Kita-uroko-ari] in his faunal survey in Miyagi Prefecture, the northeast region of mainland of Japan. He mentioned in his discussion that S. sp. 1 is very similar to
Strumigenys lewisi S. lewisi but different from the latter only in the queen by the clearly raised mesosoma and much larger eyes. On the other hand, S. sp. 9 was firstly recorded by Onoyama (1976
Citation.Name: Onoyama

Citation.Paragraph: and S. sp. A in Onoyama (1976
Citation.Name: Onoyama

Citation.Paragraph: Measurements and indices are illustrated in Figs 1 and 2. Measurements and indices for workers and their abbreviations follow Bolton (2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph: Statistical analysis was carried out with StatView 5.0 (SAS Institute Inc.) software. HW, EL, DlO, and MsH were measured on 34 queens collected from 34 colonies from several locations. Four Okinawan colonies were tentatively regarded as S. sp. 9 based on previous distribution records (Terayama, 1999
Citation.Name: Terayama

Citation.Paragraph: S. Amano leg.; [j 1047 - 52] 3 dqq, 3 ww, Manazurumisaki, Kanagawa Pref., 60 m alt., 7. i. 1973
Citation.Name: i

Citation.Paragraph: K. Onoyama leg.; [j 316 a-c] 1 aq, 1 dq, 1 w, same locality, 80 m alt., 7. i. 1975
Citation.Name: i

Citation.Paragraph:
Strumigenys Strumigenys sp. 9 is an intraspecific variation of
Strumigenys lewisi S. lewisi , the queens of the former having larger lateral ocelli and higher mesoscutum. In the previous studies, S. sp. 9 was distinguished from
Strumigenys lewisi S. lewisi by the thicker mesoscutum in the queen (Onoyama, 1976
Citation.Name: Onoyama

Citation.Paragraph:
In addition, there are not only morphological, but also geographical and ecological bases for separating
Strumigenys kumadori S. kumadori and
Strumigenys lewisi S. lewisi . The distribution areas and sites of the two species overlap in Honshu, Kyushu, and Korea (JADG, 2003
Citation.Name: JADG

Citation.Paragraph:
Strumigenys lewisi Strumigenys lewisi and
Strumigenys kumadori S. kumadori are very similar in worker characters so that they were regarded as sibling species. Characters used by Bolton (2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph:
in his notes under the description of
Strumigenys godeffroyi S. godeffroyi and
Strumigenys geminata S. geminata also separate those two species from the other twelve species of godeffroyi-complex (in Bolton, 2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph:
diagnosis for the genus
Strumigenys Strumigenys , the numbers of intercalary teeth is one or two. He also mentioned in his notes for comparing between the godeffroyi-group and mayri-group that two is the usual number in the godeffroyi-group (Bolton, 2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph: Some species having three intercalary teeth are recorded in other species group in Bolton (2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph:
In addition, the usual state of hairs on apicoscrobe and mesonotum in
Strumigenys lewisi S. lewisi did not agree with those of godeffroyi-complex in subgroup A of the godeffroyi-group, although the complexes were practically subdivided by Bolton (2000
Citation.Name: Bolton

Citation.Paragraph:
Before the present study, 8 species and 2 undetermined species and a key to the 10 species were provided for Japanese
Strumigenys Strumigenys (JADG 2003
Citation.Name: JADG

Citation.Paragraph:
In the present study, the taxonomic status of the two undetermined species was clarified and now the Japanese
Strumigenys Strumigenys fauna includes 10 valid species as below. We also provide a new key to species of Japanese
Strumigenys Strumigenys which is a revised version of the key in JADG (2003
Citation.Name: JADG
